Research

Source: vignettes/research.Rmd
research.Rmd

Here is an updated list of papers related the sentometrics package, or more broadly about textual sentiment analysis (most of which use the package for underlying calculations). These research projects are carried out by a joint group of collaborators working at the intersection of sentiment analysis and econometrics.

Vignette

An extensive introduction to the package.

  • Ardia, D., Bluteau, K., Borms, S. & Boudt, K. (2020). The R package sentometrics to compute, aggregate and predict with textual sentiment. Forthcoming in Journal of Statistical Software. Link.

Survey

An overview of the required steps in a typical econometric analysis of sentiment from textual data.

  • Algaba, A., Ardia, D., Bluteau, K., Borms & S., Boudt, K. (2020). Econometrics meets sentiment: An overview of methodology and applications. Forthcoming in Journal of Economic Surveys. Link.

Empirical applications

  • Borms, S., Boudt, K., Van Holle, F. & Willems, J. (2020). Semi-supervised text mining for monitoring the news about the ESG performance of companies. Working paper.

  • Algaba, A., Borms, S., Boudt, K. & Verbeken, B. (2020). Monitoring consumer confidence: A real-time approach using media news articles. Working paper.

  • Algaba, A., Borms, S., Boudt, K. & Van Pelt, J. (2020). The Economic Policy Uncertainty index for Flanders, Wallonia and Belgium. Working paper. Link.

  • Ardia, D., Bluteau, K. & Boudt, K. (2019). Media and the stock market: Their relationship and abnormal dynamics around earnings announcements. Working paper. Link.

  • Ardia, D., Bluteau, K. & Boudt, K. (2019). Questioning the news about economic growth: Sparse forecasting using thousands of news-based sentiment values. International Journal of Forecasting 35, 1370–1386. Link.

Contents

Developed by Samuel Borms, David Ardia, Keven Bluteau, Kris Boudt.

Site built with pkgdown 1.5.1.
